title: Norah Jones - Feels Like Home
description:

Diferente do quieto e romÃƒÂ¢ntico espÃƒÂ­rito de Come Away With Me, Jones variou o ritmo no novo CD para refletir a evoluÃƒÂ§ÃƒÂ£o de suas performances aos vivo com toques de country, pop e jazz.

English
-------
Norah Jones blew everybody away with her jazzy, country-tinged, Grammy-winning debut CD, Come Away with Me. On this recording, Jones doesn&#039;t mess with her trademark formula. Under Arif Mardin&#039;s cozy coproduction, Jones is supported by her writing partners, her Handsome Band, and some special guests (country legend Dolly Parton, Levon Helm and Garth Hudson of the Band, and jazz drummer Brian Blade, to name a few). Jones&#039;s Texas-twanged vocals and her sparse acoustic and electric Wurlitzer piano lines enliven the CD&#039;s 13 tracks, from the light and lively single "Sunrise" to Tom Waits&#039;s "The Long Way Home" and the bouncy duet with Parton, "Creepin&#039; In." Jones&#039;s soul-baring piano/vocal rendition of Duke Ellington&#039;s "Melancholia," retitled "Don&#039;t Miss You at All," proves she&#039;s a true Blue Note artist with unlimited potential.
